verses.kjv: Give ear to my prayer, O God; and hide not thyself from my supplication.
verses.ct: Listen to my prayer, O God; don't turn away from my plea for help.

verses.kjv: Attend unto me, and hear me: I mourn in my complaint, and make a noise;
verses.ct: Pay attention to me and answer me. I'm restless with grief, and I groan aloud

verses.kjv: Because of the voice of the enemy, because of the oppression of the wicked: for they cast iniquity upon me, and in wrath they hate me.
verses.ct: because of what my enemies are saying, because of the pressure the wicked put on me. They pile accusations on me, and they attack me with fury.

verses.kjv: My heart is sore pained within me: and the terrors of death are fallen upon me.
verses.ct: My heart is in agony inside me, and the dread of death has gripped me.

verses.kjv: Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me, and horror hath overwhelmed me.
verses.ct: Fear and shaking have overtaken me, and I am overwhelmed with horror.

verses.kjv: And I said, Oh that I had wings like a dove! for then would I fly away, and be at rest.
verses.ct: I said, 'If only I had wings like a dove! I would fly away and find peace.

verses.kjv: Lo, then would I wander far off, and remain in the wilderness. Selah.
verses.ct: I would escape far away and stay out in the wilderness.' Selah.

verses.kjv: I would hasten my escape from the windy storm and tempest.
verses.ct: I would rush to find shelter from the raging wind and storm.

verses.kjv: Destroy, O Lord, and divide their tongues: for I have seen violence and strife in the city.
verses.ct: Confuse them, Lord, and scramble their plans, because I see violence and conflict throughout the city.

verses.kjv: Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof: mischief also and sorrow are in the midst of it.
verses.ct: Day and night they patrol its walls; trouble and misery fill it.

verses.kjv: Wickedness is in the midst thereof: deceit and guile depart not from her streets.
verses.ct: Destruction is everywhere inside it; threats and lies never leave its streets.

verses.kjv: For it was not an enemy that reproached me; then I could have borne it: neither was it he that hated me that did magnify himself against me; then I would have hid myself from him:
verses.ct: If an enemy had insulted me, I could have endured it. If someone who hated me had risen up against me, I could have hidden from him.

verses.kjv: But it was thou, a man mine equal, my guide, and mine acquaintance.
verses.ct: But it was you â€” someone I considered my equal, my close companion, my trusted friend.

verses.kjv: We took sweet counsel together, and walked unto the house of God in company.
verses.ct: We used to share deep conversations together and walk side by side to the house of God.

verses.kjv: Let death seize upon them, and let them go down quick into hell: for wickedness is in their dwellings, and among them.
verses.ct: Let death come on them suddenly; let them go down alive to the grave, because evil lives in their homes and in their hearts.

verses.kjv: As for me, I will call upon God; and the LORD shall save me.
verses.ct: But as for me, I will call out to God, and the LORD will rescue me.

verses.kjv: Evening, and morning, and at noon, will I pray, and cry aloud: and he shall hear my voice.
verses.ct: In the evening, in the morning, and at noon, I will pray and cry out, and he will hear my voice.

verses.kjv: He hath delivered my soul in peace from the battle that was against me: for there were many with me.
verses.ct: He has brought my soul safely through the battle waged against me, even though many opposed me.

verses.kjv: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.
verses.ct: God, who has been enthroned from the beginning, will hear and bring them low. Selah. Because they never change their ways, they have no reverence for God.

verses.kjv: He hath put forth his hands against such as be at peace with him: he hath broken his covenant.
verses.ct: My companion attacked those who were at peace with him; he violated his covenant.

verses.kjv: The words of his mouth were smoother than butter, but war was in his heart: his words were softer than oil, yet were they drawn swords.
verses.ct: His speech was smoother than butter, but war filled his heart. His words were softer than oil, yet they were like drawn swords.

verses.kjv: Cast thy burden upon the LORD, and he shall sustain thee: he shall never suffer the righteous to be moved.
verses.ct: Hand your burdens over to the LORD, and he will sustain you. He will never let the righteous be shaken.

verses.kjv: But thou, O God, shalt bring them down into the pit of destruction: bloody and deceitful men shall not live out half their days; but I will trust in thee.
verses.ct: But you, O God, will bring them down to the pit of destruction. Violent and deceptive people will not live out half their days. But I will put my trust in you.
